alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Chesterfield; City of Colonial Heights; City of Petersburg; Dinwiddie; Nottoway (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 06 at 6:21PM EDT until April 06 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Chesterfield County in central Virginia... The City of Colonial Heights in central Virginia... Southeastern Nottoway County in south central Virginia... The City of Petersburg in south central Virginia... Dinwiddie County in south central Virginia... Southeastern Amelia County in central Virginia... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 620 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Chula to Spainville to near Nottoway, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Moseley, Mannboro and Wilsons around 625 PM EDT. Sutherland and Chesterfield Court House around 650 PM EDT. McKenney, Chester, Bellwood and Bensley around 655 PM EDT. Petersburg, Dinwiddie, Colonial Heights, Virginia State University, Dewitt, Matoaca and Ettrick around 700 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include North Wellville, Addison, Ammon, Forkland, Darvills, Pocahontas State Park, Church Road, Skinquarter, Wellville and Beach. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Chesterfield; City of Colonial Heights; City of Petersburg; Dinwiddie; Nottoway
